display.title: Himalayan animal tales / by Dorothy Mierow.
display.creator: Mierow, Dorothy.
display.subject: Mountain animals -- Himalaya Mountains; Zoology -- Nepal; Animals -- Himalaya Mountains -- Pictorial works; Himalaya Mountains -- Pictorial works
display.lds03: [12] p., 40 leaves, [14] p. : col. illus. ; 21 cm.
display.lds05: Hill village farm -- The chicken's nightmare -- Clean-up crew -- Night visitors at the rabbit cage -- Garden visitors -- Evening visitors to the fruit trees -- Visitors in a maize field above Rupa Tal -- In the apple orchard -- Fire used in hunting -- Playmates in teh village community forest -- The tourists delight -- Co-operation -- Night prowlers -- Dolphins with gavial and marsh crocodile -- Playful otters -- Wild relatives -- Sweet-tooth -- The yellow-throated marten -- A dangerous encounter -- Jungle queen -- Impeyan pheasants and musk deer -- Pikas and Himalayan tahrs -- Snow leopard and blue sheep -- Bhutan: takin with baby meets serow -- Chase the enemy -- Do they see a yeti? -- Perhaps it was a bear -- Wild relatives of our sheep and goats -- Animals once abundant on the Tibetan plateau -- Domesticated animals of the high mountains -- Good fishing -- Golden langurs teasing a marbled cat -- Assam hill forest -- At the termite next -- Some rare types to look for -- Jungle fire -- Rivals -- Which is in danger? -- Danger at dawn -- Mogul period hunt scene.
display.lds07: Pub. white color printed pictorial wrappers.
display.lds24: A collection of forty short stories describing Nepalese and Himalayan animal life. The book is divided into four parts: house and farm animals; animals of the lowland Terai; animals of the high mountains; and animals of India's lowlands. At the end of the text is an index of the animals described and their habitats.

addata.btitle: Himalayan animal tales / by Dorothy Mierow.
addata.abstract: A collection of forty short stories describing Nepalese and Himalayan animal life. The book is divided into four parts: house and farm animals; animals of the lowland Terai; animals of the high mountains; and animals of India's lowlands. At the end of the text is an index of the animals described and their habitats.
